author: JEANETTE SETTEMBRE
title: 'Today' co-host Hoda Kotb adopts baby girl
text:
Tuesday, February 21, 2017, 9:21 AM 
“Today” show anchor Hoda Kotb is taking on a new role — mommy. 
The 52-year-old TV star adopted a baby girl, Haley Joy Kotb, she announced Tuesday. The bundle of joy is Kotb’s first child. 
The morning show host shared a sweet photo of herself holding the adorable newborn on “Today.” — Hoda Kotb (@hodakotb) February 21, 2017 
“That little girl, Haley Joy — I’m crying — is my daughter,” Kotb announced over the phone. 
“She’s a Valentine’s baby so she’s a little nugget. She is the love of my life.” Hoda Kotb adopted a baby girl, Haley Joy Kotb. (Michael Loccisano/Getty Images) 
Kotb’s partner in wine, fourth-hour “Today” co-host Kathie Lee Gifford, managed to keep the news under wraps. 
“We are thrilled for you, sweetheart. You were made to be a mom,” she said. So thrilled for @hodakotb and her precious daughter, Haley Joy!! She will be the best mommy ever! We love you, Hoda, enjoy every moment!❤️❤️ — Kathie Lee Gifford (@KathieLGifford) February 21, 2017 
Kotb, who has a tradition of posting inspirational quotes on social media, sparked speculation about the newborn when she shared sweet sentiments about new beginnings earlier in the week. 
Last year, Kotb announced she moved in with her longtime boyfriend, Joel Schiffman. The pair have been dating since 2013. Join the Conversation:
